#Text=Indiana legislators vote for state constitutional ban on same-sex marriage
#Text=Thursday , February 20 , 2014
#Text=Laws regarding same-sex partnerships in the United States ██Same-sex marriage1
#Text=██Unions granting rights similar to marriage1,2
#Text=██Legislation granting limited/enumerated rights1
#Text=██Same-sex marriages performed elsewhere recognized1
#Text=██No specific prohibition or recognition of same-sex marriages or unions
#Text=██Statute bans same-sex marriage
#Text=██Constitution bans same-sex marriage
#Text=██Constitution bans same-sex marriage and some or all other kinds of same-sex unions
#Text=1May include recent laws or court decisions which have created legal recognition of same-sex relationships , but which have not entered into effect yet .
#Text=2Same-sex marriage laws in California are complicated , please see the Wikipedia article on same-sex marriage in California .
#Text=Indiana 's Senate passed a proposed constitutional amendment Monday that would ban same-sex marriage in the state 's constitution .
#Text=Indiana 's state law already prohibits same-sex marriage .
#Text=A sentence banning civil unions was removed from the proposal .

#Text=For a constitutional amendment to be approved in Indiana , it must pass both the House of Representatives and the Senate during two separately elected legislatures , which means there has to be an election between the two sets of votes .
#Text=The proposed amendment cannot be changed from one voting session to another and cannot be changed from the House of Representatives to the Senate .
#Text=Once the proposed amendment has passed those hurdles , then the amendment goes to Indiana voters who vote yea or nay on the amendment .
#Text=Following the House of Representatives ' approval , the Senate passed the proposed amendment , which is known as House Joint Resolution 3 , with a vote of 32 – 17 Monday .
#Text=Opponents needed eight more votes to stop the proposed amendment from reaching the necessary margin of support .
#Text=The proposed amendment already passed both houses in 2011 .
#Text=A change was made this legislative session when the second sentence was deleted first by the House of Representatives and then was passed in a similar form by the Senate Monday .
#Text=The failure of the second sentence , which proposes to ban same-sex civil unions , could possibly open the door for civil unions in the future .
#Text=Following the process , HJR-3 will be reviewed again by the next elected legislature in either 2015 or 2016 to remain in process .
#Text=Although the amended version grants the possibility for civil unions in the future , some in the LGBT ( Lesbian , Gay , Bisexual , Transgender ) community say it is n't enough .

#Text=" I think it 's still bad because it fails to legitimize us as human beings , since it 's trying to deny us basic rights , ” said Myranda Wanden , program director at Indiana Youth Group , an organization that provides support and advocacy for LBGT teens and young adults .
